question: Which two countries fought the battle "War of '40"?
explanation: Greece and Italy fought the battle "War of '40". The Greco-Italian War (Italo-Greek War, Italian Campaign in Greece; also known as "War of '40" in Greece) took place between the kingdoms of Italy and Greece from 28 October 1940 to 23 April 1941. This local war began the Balkans Campaign of World War II between the Axis powers and the Allies. It turned into the Battle of Greece when British and German ground forces intervened early in 1941.
